from JumpScale import j

    def __init__(self):
        self.subblocks=[]

[docs]class ByteProcessor:
    'ByteProcessor'
    @staticmethod

[docs]    def hashMd5(s):
        import hashlib
        if isinstance(s, unicode):
            s = s.encode('utf-8')
        impl = hashlib.md5(s)
        return impl.hexdigest()


    @staticmethod

[docs]    def hashTiger160(s):
        import mhash
        if isinstance(s, unicode):
            s = s.encode('utf-8')
        h=mhash.MHASH(mhash.MHASH_TIGER160,s)
        return h.hexdigest()


    @staticmethod

[docs]    def hashTiger160bin(s):
        import mhash
        if isinstance(s, unicode):
            s = s.encode('utf-8')
        h=mhash.MHASH(mhash.MHASH_TIGER160,s)
        return h.digest()


    @staticmethod

[docs]    def hashTiger192(s):
        import mhash
        h=mhash.MHASH(mhash.MHASH_TIGER,s)
        return h.hexdigest()


    @staticmethod

[docs]    def compress(s):
        import blosc
        return blosc.compress(s, typesize=8)


    @staticmethod

[docs]    def decompress(s):
        import blosc
        return blosc.decompress(s)


    @staticmethod

[docs]    def disperse(s,nrblocks, extrablocks,compress=True):
        """
        returns DispersedBlock object
        """
        db=DispersedBlock()
        db.create(s,nrblocks,extrablocks,compress)
        return db


    @staticmethod

[docs]    def getDispersedBlockObject():
        return DispersedBlock


    @staticmethod

[docs]    def undisperse(dispersedBlockObject,uncompress=True):
        dispersedBlockObject.restore




j.base.byteprocessor=ByteProcessor
